decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines. With Aminatou, the Fateshifter as the commander, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition. By constantly manipulating the top of the library, the deck can ensure that it has access to the necessary answers and threats at any given time. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler, as well as versatile cards like Parallax Wave and Demonic Tutor, allows the deck to adapt to various situations and come out on top in a 1 vs 1 Duel Commander format.

This deck revolves around fast-paced aggressiveness and strategic disruption. It utilizes a mix of efficient creatures, removal spells, and countermagic to apply pressure on the opponent while controlling the board. The inclusion of powerful commanders like Aragorn, King of Gondor, combined with versatile spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, allows for flexibility in dealing with various threats. The deck aims to establish early board presence, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and close out the game quickly. By combining speed and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm its opponent and secure victory through relentless attacks and precise decision-making.

This deck revolves around the combo potential of Old Stickfingers as the commander, utilizing a variety of spells and graveyard recursion to quickly assemble powerful synergies and win conditions. The key strategy involves quickly ramping up mana with efficient spells like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual, while disrupting opponents with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize. By using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead, the deck can consistently bring back key creatures from the graveyard, allowing for repetitive ETB effects and strong board presence. The deck also includes a suite of removal spells and disruption to control the game until it is able to assemble its combo pieces and close out the game with cards like Tendrils of Agony.

This deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent while leveraging Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger as a powerful threat. It contains a mix of removal spells, hand disruption, and graveyard recursion to keep the opponent off balance. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while deploying threats like Kroxa to close out the game. The deck is designed to control the board and out-value the opponent over the course of the game, ensuring that Kroxa's abilities can be used to their full potential. By combining disruption and powerful threats, the deck aims to control the game and emerge victorious in the 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize Teferi, Temporal Archmage's abilities to generate infinite mana and take multiple extra turns in order to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a variety of counterspells, bounce spells, and card draw to control the game and find the necessary combo pieces to achieve the infinite mana loop. Cards like High Tide, Extraplanar Lens, and artifact tutors such as Fabricate and Whir of Invention help ramp up the mana production. Once the combo is assembled, the deck can deploy powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End or Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to quickly close out the game.
